text: Which of the following quantities is not an example of force?
explanation: Mass is a measure of how much matter is in an object.

text: The reason for laminating the soft iron core of a  transformer is to?
explanation: Laminated iron core means insulating layers glued compact. Now the cores are laminated to reduce Eddy current.

text: Formation of hydrogen bubbles at the copper plate of a primary cell is called?
explanation:
Polarization:The hydrogen bubbles which are clinging over the surface of copper electrode anode becomes a thin film of hydrogen over the copper electrode.
This hydrogen film increases the internal resistance and reduces the emf of the cell and hence the cell soon becomes inactive. This effect is known as polarization

text: Which of the following factors does not affect the rate of evaporation of a liquid?
explanation: The rate of evaporation depends ontemperature, presence of wind, the humidity of the surrounding, and the surface area of the liquid exposed to the atmosphere. It doesn't depend on the mass of the liquid. The larger the surface area, the more would be the rate of evaporation.

text: Opening in the eye through which light passes to the retina is called the?
explanation: The function of the pupil is clearly that ofcontrolling the amount of light entering the eye, and hence the light reflex.

text: A heat sensitive resistor made of a semiconductor is called?
explanation: Thermistorsact as a passive component in a circuit. They are an accurate, cheap, and robust way to measure temperature.

text: Electric motor primarily converts?
explanation: An electric motor is an electrical machine thatconverts electrical energy into mechanical energy.

text: The handle of a screw jack is 35 cm long and the pitch of the screw is 0.5 cm. What force must be applied at the end of the handle to lift a load of 2000N, if the efficiency of the jack is 30% [π = \(\frac{22}{7}\)]?
explanation:
GIVEN:
Handle length r = 35cm = 0.35cm, pitch of screw = 0.5cm = 0.005cm, load W = 2000N, efficiency = 30%
V.R of screw = \(\frac{2\pi r}{p}\) =  \(\frac{2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times 0.35}{0.005}\) = 440
Eff = \(\frac{\text{M.A}}{\text{V.R}}\) x 100
M.A = eff. x V. R = 0.3 x 440 = 132
Effort = \(\frac{L}{M.A}\) = \(\frac{2000}{132}\) ≈ 15.2N

text: The diagram above illustrates the velocity-time graph of a body. Calculate the distance covered by the body during the motion
explanation: Distance covered = Area under the graphD = area of square + area of trapeziumD = L x L + 1/2(a+b)hD = 4 x 4 + 1/2( 4+ 10)8D = 16 + 1/2 x 14 x 8D = 16 + 56D = 72m.

text: An atom that emits an a-particle?

options.B: becomes a different isotope of the element.
options.D: becomes a daughter of a different element always.

explanation:
Alpha decay or α-decay is a type of radioactive decay in which an atomic nucleus emitsan alpha particle (helium nucleus)and
thereby transforms or 'decays' into a different atomic nucleus, with a mass number that is reduced by four and an atomic number that is reduced by two.

text: Which of the following units is equivalent to the unit of electric current?
explanation:
Q = ItI = Q/t
I = C / s
= Cs\(^{-1}\)

text: A ball is swung in a horizontal circle of centre O with a constant speed. What is the direction of its acceleration?

options.B: Along the Circumference of the circle
options.D: Along a tangent to the circle

explanation: Simple harmonic motion (SHM) is a special type of periodic motion where the restoring force on the moving object is directly proportional to the magnitude of the object's displacement and acts towards the object's equilibrium position.

text: Which of the following statements is an effect of compressing gas molecules at constant temperature?

options.A: The pressure on the molecules decreases.
options.B: The molecules gain more kinetic energy.
options.C: The molecules make more impact per second on the walls of the container.

explanation:
More collisions mean more force, so the pressure will increase.
When the volume decreases, the pressure increases.
This shows that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume.
This is shown by  Boyle's law.

text: The diagram above is an illustration of an a.c. circuit.Calculate the reactance of the capacitor.
A current of 2A passes through a wire of resistance 4Ω for 3 minutes. Calculate the energy lost.
explanation:
Power = current[I]\(^2\) * Resistance[R] → 2\(^2\) * 4 → 4 * 4 = 16watts
time = 3minutes → 3 * 60 = 180s
Energy = power * time → 16 * 180 = 2880j

text: Which of the following statements about the universal gravitational constant, G, is true?

options.C: Its S.I. unit is N m\(^2\)kg

explanation:
The universal Gravitational constant(G) is a scalar quantity as it is not in a particular direction.
dimensional formula=M-¹L³T-²
S.I. unit = Nm\(^2\)/kg\(^2\)

text:
The sketched graph above represents a progressive wave moving from the left to the right. The period of the wave is 0.125s.
Determine the values of the amplitude and wavelength, respectively, of the wave.
explanation:
Amplitude = 16cm/2 = 8cm ( displacement from mean position)
3\(\lambda\) = 27cm
\(\lambda\) = \(\frac{27}{3}\) = 9cm
Therefore, amplitude(A) = 8cm and \(\lambda\) = 9cm

text: Determine the speed of the wave.
explanation:
Speed = Wavelength x Frequency
or
V = fλ, where frequency = 1/period, f = 1/T.
The period was given as 0.125sec and wavelength = 9cm
: f = 1/T = 1/0125 = 8.
V = fλ = 8 × 9 = 72m/s

text: Which of the following curved surfaces will produce a real image? I. Concave mirror II. Convex mirror III. Diverging lens IV. Converging lens
explanation:
Concave mirror: A concave mirror can produce a real image when the object is placed outside the focal point. While,Convex mirror: a convex mirror always produces virtual images.
Diverging lens: A diverging lens (concave lens) always produces virtual images. While,Converging lens: a converging lens (convex lens) can produce a real image when the object is placed outside the focal point.

text: The components of vectors Q and R are (-3.0, 5.5) and (9.2, 4.4) respectively. Determine the components of Q + R.
explanation:
Put the vectors in their component forms
Q( -3.0i, 5.5j) and P(9.2i, 4.4j)
Q + P =  -3.0i, 5.5j + 9.2i, 4.4j = ( - 3.0 + 9.2)i  +  ( 5.5 + 4.4)j = ( 6.2i + 9.9j)
therefore Q + P = (6.2 , 9.9).

text: Which of the arrangements of radiations below shows decreasing order of wavelengths?
explanation: radio waves have a longer wavelength than infrared light, and infrared than x-rays in the electromagnetic spectrum.

text: In the diagram above, a bulb is lit by drawing 2.0A from 440V a.c. source. Calculate the cost of keeping the bulb on for two days at $0.40 per kilowatt-hour.
explanation:
Power[p] = IV → 2 * 440 = 880Watt
Energy = p * t = 880 * 48hrs
= 42240 or 42.24kwh
But 1 kwh cost $0.40∴ 42.24kwh costs 42.24 x 0.40
= 16.896 or $16.90

text:
A wire of cross-sectional area 2π  x  10\(^-{8}\) m\(^2\) and resistivity 1.1 x 10\(^-{8}\) Ω m, has a resistance of 21Ω.
Calculate the length of the wire. [π=22/7]
explanation:
To calculate the length of the wire, we use the formula for resistance:
\(R = \frac{\rho \cdot L}{A}\)
Where:- \( R \) is the resistance (21 Ω),- \( \rho \) is the resistivity (\( 1.1 \times 10^{-8} \, \Omega \, m \)),- \( L \) is the length of the wire,- \( A \) is the cross-sectional area (\( 2\pi \times 10^{-8} \, m^2 \)).
Rearranging the formula to solve for length \( L \): \(L = \frac{R \cdot A}{\rho}\)
Substituting the known values, we first calculate the area \( A \):
\(A = 2\pi \times 10^{-8} \, m^2 = 2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times 10^{-8} \approx 8.0 \times 10^{-8} \, m^2\)
Now substitute into the length formula: \(L = \frac{21 \, \Omega \cdot 8.0 \times 10^{-8} \, m^2}{1.1 \times 10^{-8} \, \Omega \, m}\)
Calculating:
\(L = \frac{21 \cdot 8.0}{1.1}\)m
\(L = \frac{168}{1.1} \, m \approx 120\)m

text: Which of the following statements best describes the particles in a solid at room temperature? They are
explanation: The particles of a solid are packed closely together. The forces between the particles are strong enough that the particles cannot move freely; they can only vibrate. As a result, a solid has a stable, definite shape and a definite volume.

text: A man weighing 200 N runs up a staircase in 5s. If the height of the staircase is 9 m, calculate the power of the man.
explanation:
power = \(\frac{force * distance}{time}\) →  \(\frac{200 *  9}{5}\)
power = 36w

text: A force of 10 N, acting continuously, increases the kinetic energy of an object from 20.J to 60 J. Find the distance moved by the object.
explanation:
according to the work-energy theorem; Workdone = change in kinetic energy.
W = ∆ K.E
force x distance = \(K.E_2 - K.E_2\)
10 x s = 60 - 20
s = \(\frac{40}{10}\) = 4m.

text: A stone is thrown horizontally with initial velocity 15m/s from a tower 20 m high. How long does it take to reach the ground? [g= 10m/s\(^2\)
explanation:
\(h = \frac{1}{2} g t^2\), at max height v = 0m/s
Given: h = 20m, g = 10 ms\(^2\)
Rearranging:\(t^2 = \frac{2h}{g} = \frac{2 \times 20}{10} = 4\)\(t = \sqrt{4}\) = 2s
Thus, the time to reach the ground is: t = 2s
